libshapedraw.primitive
Interface ReadonlyVector3

All Known Implementing Classes:
Vector3
public interface ReadonlyVector3

Read-only interface for Vector3 objects, allowing for compile-time safety.

See Also:
Vector3

equals

@Deprecated
boolean equals(Object other)
Deprecated. 

Equivalent to equalsExact(ReadonlyVector3).

This method is marked as deprecated because it's better practice to explicitly state margins of error for floating-point comparisons. For a non-zero margin of error, use equals(ReadonlyVector3, double).

Overrides:

isZero

boolean isZero()
Returns:
true if all of this vector's components are exactly zero.

lengthSquared

double lengthSquared()
Equivalent to distanceSquared(Vector3.ZEROS).

Returns:
the vector's length (aka magnitude) squared. To compare two two vectors' lengths, use this method instead of length() as it avoids the relatively expensive sqrt call.

length

double length()
Equivalent to distance(Vector3.ZEROS).

Returns:
the vector's length (aka magnitude). This uses the relatively expensive sqrt function, so avoid calling it repeatedly.

distanceSquared

double distanceSquared(ReadonlyVector3 other)
Returns:
the distance between two points, squared. If you're trying to compare two distances, use this method instead of distance(libshapedraw.primitive.ReadonlyVector3) as it avoids the relatively expensive sqrt call.

dot

double dot(ReadonlyVector3 other)
Returns:
the dot product between two vectors: x0*x1 + y0*y1 + z0*z1.

angle

double angle(ReadonlyVector3 other)
Returns:
the angle, in radians [0, pi], between two vectors. If either vector is all zeros, 0 is returned.

angleDegrees

double angleDegrees(ReadonlyVector3 other)
Returns:
the angle, in degrees [0, 180], between two vectors. If either vector is all zeros, 0 is returned.

yaw

double yaw()
Returns:
the angle, in radians (-pi/2, pi/2] of the vector direction's heading, relative to the z axis.

yawDegrees

double yawDegrees()
Returns:
the angle, in degrees (-180, 180] of the vector direction's heading, relative to the z axis.

pitch

double pitch()
Returns:
the angle, in radians [-pi/2, pi/2] of the vector direction's elevation.

pitchDegrees

double pitchDegrees()
Returns:
the angle, in degrees [-90, 90] of the vector direction's elevation.

                 ReadonlyVector3 upperColor)
Returns:
true if the point is inside the axis-aligned bounding box specified by the two corner parameters.

boolean isInSphere(ReadonlyVector3 origin,
                   double radius)
Returns:
true if the point is inside the sphere.

glApplyRotateDegrees

void glApplyRotateDegrees(double angleDegrees)
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glRotated(angleDegrees, v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

Calling this method on a zero vector is a no-op.

"Un-applying" the rotation (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

glApplyRotateRadians

void glApplyRotateRadians(double angleRadians)
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glRotated(angleRadians*180.0/Math.PI, v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

Calling this method on a zero vector is a no-op.

"Un-applying" the rotation (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

glApplyScale

void glApplyScale()
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glScaled(v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

"Un-applying" the scaling (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

glApplyTranslate

void glApplyTranslate()
Convenience method to update the OpenGL state with this vector.

Equivalent to GL11.glTranslated(v.getX(), v.getY(), v.getZ()).

"Un-applying" the translation (e.g., glPushMatrix and glPopMatrix) is the responsibility of the caller.

All of these operations are actually deprecated in OpenGL 3.0, but Minecraft is just old school like that.

isAnimating

boolean isAnimating()
Returns:
true if this vector is being updated by an active animation.
